etymologies: mid 17th century: from Arabic ḥaram, ḥarīm, literally ‘prohibited, prohibited place’ (hence ‘sanctuary, women's quarters, women’), from ḥarama ‘be prohibited’. Compare with haram

definitions: (in former times) the separate part of a Muslim household reserved for wives, concubines, and female servants

examples.text: we were invited into the harem in the rear of the house

shortDefinitions: separate part of household reserved for women

definitions: the women occupying a harem; the wives (or concubines) of a polygamous man

examples.text: the Maharaja of Delhi had a very fine harem of 18 young and nubile wives

shortDefinitions: wives or concubines of polygamous man

definitions: a group of female animals sharing a single mate

examples.text: the dominant bulls gather a harem of anything from two to ten cows

shortDefinitions: group of female animals sharing single mate

definitions: a group of women perceived as centering around a particular man

examples.text: rich men with their extensive harems of buxom blondes

shortDefinitions: group of women centring around a particular man
